channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3548] If you do this, FUCK YOU [pic]
[+2702] What your email address says about you - The Oatmeal
item.description: An email address can be a great indicator of how capable you are with a computer.

item.title: [+2145] Very clever advertisement [Pic]
[+1597] Spot the IT Consultant (PIC)
item.description: If their job titles weren’t properly labelled would you be able to spot the IT Consultant? Hmmmm…..

item.title: [+1297] Subway Finally Agrees to Tessellate Cheese
item.description: Every generation has a moment that defines it. This is ours.

item.title: [+1069] Reports: Israeli ships attack aid flotilla, 2 dead - Yahoo!
item.description: Israeli warships attacked at least one of the six ships carrying pro-Palestinian activists and aid for blockaded Gaza, killing at least two and wounding an unknown number of people on board, an Arabic satellite service and a Turkish TV network reported early Monday.

item.title: [+922] Aggressive Maneuvers for Autonomous Quadrotor Flight
[+896] Shocking Video: Animal Cruelty at PETCO supplier
item.description: A PETA investigator went undercover at Sun Pet Ltd., a wholesale animal dealer that supplies animals to PETCO and PetSmart, among other chains. Video footage shows employees bashing hamsters against tables and committing other gruesome deeds.

item.title: [+860] Could new Ebola cure be magic bullet for other viruses?
item.description: In what may be the biggest medical breakthrough of its kind, scientists have developed a completely new type of treatment that appears to cure Ebola. They report a 100% success rate. This is a breakthrough not only because it may give us a cure for an uncurable, incredibly nasty virus, but also because the same method might work for other viruses.

item.title: [+834] Woman suing Google over directions that got her hit by a car
item.description: A Utah woman used Google Maps' walking directions on her Blackberry and was given directions to walk onto a highway. She got hit and is now suing Google for damages.

item.title: [+823] Couple Discover They Are Siblings
item.description: A young couple have revealed how they fell in love after meeting at a nightclub, moved in together, had a child, and then discovered they were, in fact, half-brother and sister.

item.title: [+708] Should Happy Meals be banned?
item.description: Should Happy Meals be outlawed? Apparently a group of lawmakers in California think so. This week, in a 3-2 vote, they made it illegal to sell meals containing a toy incentive in Santa Clara

item.title: [+645] Artist Builds a Replica "Back to the Future" Hoverboard
item.description: Who hasn’t wished at some point that they could take a spin on Marty McFly’s hoverboard from Back to the Future II? The hoverboard may not be an actual form of transportation yet, but French artist Nils Guadagnin has built a working replica of McFly’s floating board for an exhibition entitled, appropriately enough, “Back to the Future”.

item.title: [+581] No U.S. Cities in Top 25 Best Cities of the World | WTF?
item.description: London-based consulting company Mercer released their yearly rankings of the 25 most liveable cities, and no American cities make the grade. Vienna is number one, and Vancouver takes fourth.

item.title: [+569] Scott Pilgrim Vs. The World - New Theatrical Trailer
item.description: Edgar Wright is best known for the brilliant Shaun of The Dead and Hot Fuzz, but after watching the trailer for the upcoming Scott Pilgrim VS. The World-- that may all be changing very soon. It's 100% unadulterated awesome.

item.title: [+546] The 15 Best and Worst Series Finales in TV History
item.description: When a much-loved show ends, fans want it to end a certain way, and the final episode can mean the difference between a happy audience and one that refuses to buy the DVD.
